page.title: 07ROADS IN STUBHAMPTON AREA
page.content: There are 3 west-east routes in the area, all unclassified narrow roads carrying little traffic. The Fontmell Magna to Ashmore road climbs a steep hill to cross the Shaftesbury to Blandford road, then runs downhill to pass the northern end of Stubhampton Bottom, from where it rises again towards Ashmore. Part of this road is single lane with passing places. About 500m south of the Fontmell Magna to Ashmore road, a road climbs up from Sutton Waldron to meet the Shaftesbury to Blandford road at "Sutton Clump". The Iwerne Minster to Tarrant Gunville road crosses the Shaftesbury to Blandford road at the top of the hill and then runs gently downhill past the southern end of Stubhampton Bottom and on down the Tarrant Valley.
